text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kobayashi was born in SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil on November 29, 1947. He moved to Japan and joined Japan Soccer League club Yanmar Diesel in 1971. The club won the league champions in 1971, 1974 and 1975. The club also won 1974 Emperor's Cup. He retired in 1976. He played 92 games and scored 7 goals in the league. He was selected Best Eleven in 1974 and 1975. On July 16, 1972, Kobayashi debuted for the Japan national team against Sri Lanka. He played 3 games for Japan in 1972. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1972||3||0 |- !Total||3||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Brazilian-Japanese footballers Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Cerezo Osaka players
